message.content:
cs.CV, cs.HC, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.IR. 

The paper deals with the task of accurately identifying hands in images, which is a common problem in computer vision (cs.CV). The focus is on wearable first-person point-of-view cameras, which suggests a potential application in human-computer interaction (cs.HC). The paper also mentions the use of convolutional neural networks, which is a popular machine learning technique (cs.MM). The approach involves learning a personalized user-specific hand appearance model, which could fall under the category of personalized or adaptive systems (cs.LG). Finally, the paper discusses the use of interactive bootstrapping, which could be related to active learning or interactive machine learning (cs.IR).
